result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hayes E Kressin in court with attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Defendant Hayes E Kressin in custody.  Roy La Barton Gay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ct. 1- Defendant enters no contest plea.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Filed, defendant waives right to preliminary hearing,  Defendant informed of charges and penalties.  Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights.  Factual basis and probable cause found.  Court accepts pleas as voluntarily and knowingly and intelligently made & finds Guilty Ct. 1: 
All other charges in this case, Case #15CF462 & uncharged matter #16-2024: DRI
8 yrs Prison incarceration I/S - 4 years- IC, 4 years ES- Consecutive to EC Case #15CF120 imposed sentence   
Stayed & placed on 60 mth probation effective 11/01/16
conditions: 180 days jail w/huber- to serve 35 days initially, remaining 145 days stayed pending probation compliance/completion of drug court.
No sentence credit if revoked.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Not to possess or consume any control substance not prescribed by auth. medical personnel.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 
No contact with: N.B. or her residence.
To complete assessment,counseling/treatment per agent
Provide DNA
Costs- $528.00
Restitution $4328.56 + surcharge $432.86= total: $4761.42 
Restitution in read-in cases TBD w/in 90 days of todays date.
(faxed to jail/probation #8149)
